title: Rickey Medlocke takes the stage with Blackfoot on select dates
text:
Rickey Medlocke through the years Photo by Stephen Lovekin/Getty Images for Big Barrel View all 5 photos Rickey Medlocke started his iconic career with Lynyrd Skynryd, left for a time to form his band Blackfoot and then rejoined Skynryd where he remains today. Medlocke is scheduled to perform 3 shows with the new handpicked Blackfoot in November.
Blackfootband.com It has been over 20 years since Rickey Medlocke has performed with Blackfoot and he is really looking forward to this special event. Examiner sat down with Rickey Medlocke recently and spoke to him about the past, the present, the future and the new Blackfoot record and this is what he had to say:
Examiner (Ex): Hi Rickey, how are you doing?
Rickey Medlocke (RB): Great.
Ex: I understand that you are going to be doing 3 shows with Blackfoot in November. I know you are a regular member of Skynryd and are continuing to tour with them and that these 3 shows are special events . Is Skynryd supportive of side projects like this?
RM: Oh yeah. Whether it is in music or acting in films or in television or sound tracks or whatever, we’ve all had our side projects.
Ex: So what you do with Blackfoot will be done around Skynryd’s schedule?
RM: Yes, as long as it doesn’t interfere with Lynyrd Skynryd.
Ex: Is there anything you would like the people to know about these special shows with Blackfoot?
RM: I think the people old and young should come out and give it a chance and listen to the record when it comes out. I stand by the record. The record is great and I stand by the band. The band kicks butt and they are great musicians. Everybody should give it a chance and check it out.
Ex: When is the new Blackfoot CD being released?
RM: Hopefully we are looking at by the end of the year or the first of next year.
Ex: So these dates are in support of the forthcoming new CD?
RM: Yes.
Ex: Can you tell us the name of the CD or give us a hint?
RM: No. We haven’t picked a name for it yet.
Ex: It might be interesting to have it associated with the past and the present.
RM: Yeah that’s great.
Ex: Something that ties the past and present together. I hope this brings a whole new generation of fans to get to know them and to get to know the past music and all of that.
What a great time Examiner has speaking with Rickey Medlocke. The special event shows are scheduled for:
November 19, 2015 at the Blue Ocean Music Hall, Salisbury, Massachusetts. November 20, 2015 at the Seneca Casino in Niagara Falls, New York. November 21, 2015 at the Beacon Theatre in Hopewell, Virginia. For more on Blackfoot visit their website and make sure to like them on Facebook .
